item.title: Like capitalism itself, business journalism is broken. Can it be fixed?
item.description:
It is a rare and powerful thing these days for someone to admit they were wrong. In our culture of competitive certitude, it is a risk too many of us are unwilling to take. That’s just one of the reasons I admire the New York Times business reporter David Gelles’s…

item.title: Covid 6/2/2022: Declining to Respond

Memorial Day weekend is a good reason not to worry about reporting cases or deaths. FDA declines to respond with making it easier to get treatments we have in ample supply, or to update the vaccines. Congress refuses to fund anything at all, really…

item.title: From Watershed Moment to Apocalypse Now
item.description:
Last week, I was planning to write about the newly-released report of sexual abuse in the Southern Baptist Convention, but the murders in Uvalde, Texas proved overwhelming. The story about Southern Baptists, however, is also quite important. Although it is quickly fading from the mainstream media, it shouldn’t be forgotten. The Washington Post called it…

URL: https://dianabutlerbass.substack.com/p/from-watershed-to-apocalypse-now?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: Ideas to boost Japanese growth (Part 1)
item.description:
Greetings from Tokyo! This is the second in my series of Japan-related posts. The first one was about how Japanese living standards are too low. I recommended that Japan address its high poverty rate by creating a cash-based redistributive welfare state, on top of the creaky, failing corporate welfare state that it has traditionally relied on…

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/ideas-to-boost-japanese-growth-part?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The Stakes at Salamis, &

item.title: Fault Lines #7: Ukrainskii Mir
item.description:
Endgame Three months after Putin’s illegal invasion, we have learned much we did not fully understand at the time. Russia’s military campaign has been incompetent at best, a fiasco at worst. It has sacrificed huge numbers of lives and materiel for no meaningful advance on the territories it controlled on February 24th. For now, it has dialled its war aim…

URL: https://edbrophy.substack.com/p/fault-lines-7-ukrainskii-mir?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
